Description: Fragment of neck and flattened handle to moderate turn of a Rhodian pottery transport amphora. Clay near fine red-brown. Rectangular stamp.
Curator's comments: Name Dionysios. An example from the Athenian Agora is from the same die, as is Alexandria, Greco-Roman Museum, ALEX MGR 1106.36 and BM 1989,0710.4, which has the same flaw at the left edge.
Bibliographic references: Stoddart 1847 / Memoir on the inscribed pottery of Rhodes, Cnidus and other Greek Cities (134)
